That's why your brain dwells on negative events despite positive ones.

Food tastes better when it's made by someone else.

While you're cooking a meal yourself, you get used to the smell of the ingredients.

Psychology fact of the day:

When you first wake up, you're in a state called sleep inertia.

You feel

- drowsiness
- disorientation
- decreased dexterity

This is normal, but you can shorten it with

- natural light
- not using an alarm
- napping (less than 30 minutes)

Parkinson's Law:

Work expands to fill the time available for its completion.

Want to get more done?

Give yourself less time to get it done.

Want to wake up earlier?

Get a few minutes of direct sunlight as early as you can.

‚Ä¢ shifts your circadian rhythm
‚Ä¢ makes you more energetic in the morning
‚Ä¢ helps you sleep earlier in the evening

To prevent this, keep your available options as few as possible!

A common reason for procrastination:

There isn't a good enough reason to not procrastinate.

Your brain avoids discomfort as long as it can - so you may have to give it a good reason to take action.

4. Systems to make things more efficient

Getting direct sunlight earlier in the day helps you wake up earlier.
